alert.note: Alert for Eastern Strait of Juan de Fuca; Western Strait of Juan De Fuca (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 08 at 12:50PM PST until January 09 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 4 PM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Minor coastal flooding expected. Inundation of 2 to 3 feet above ground level is possible along shorelines and low- lying coastal areas. * WHERE...Eastern Strait of Juan de Fuca and Western Strait of Juan De Fuca zones. * WHEN...From 2 AM to 4 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor coastal flooding due to tidal overflow is expected around high tide. This may lead to flooding of parking lots, parks, and roads, with only isolated road closures expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong low pressure is expected to move just north of the region Tuesday, which, when combined with strong westerly flow through the Strait of Juan de Fuca, may enhance the threat for coastal flooding Tuesday.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inundation above ground level refers to the height above the Mean Higher High Water (MHHW) level.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Strait of Juan de Fuca; Western Strait of Juan De Fuca
